title: 3. IRRI Agronomy Challenge 2: First Fertilizer Application (28 December 2012)

tasks.task: Planting and managing a crop field after initial planting, including applying fertilizer.
subtasks: Determine the correct timing for applying the first fertilizer dose post-planting.
Use a smartphone application (RISE's nutrient manager) to input field data and generate a precise fertilizer prescription.
Calculate the required amount of fertilizer based on the field size and prescription, which is 4 bags per hectare for a quarter-hectare plot.
Distribute the fertilizer uniformly across the designated field section using a manual spreading method.
Adjust the application of fertilizer between different crop varieties (input variety and hybrid) based on previous experience and software recommendations.
Understand the impact of fertilizer application timing and method on crop establishment and root development.
Reflect on potential improvements for fertilizer application in planting machines to enhance nutrient capture by plants.

tasks.task: Managing a rice crop in a traditional system without mechanical fertilization.
subtasks: Ensuring the young rice plants receive direct nutrients close to their roots using a tractor-assisted application technique.
Consider the spacing and growth stage of rice plants when applying broadcast fertilizer by hand.
Analyze the efficacy of manual fertilizer application methods and their impact on nutrient distribution compared to machine application.
